body_html:
@soumith I found the issue by checking on another computer.

It seems the most recent version of PyTorch wants to upgrade to the non-cu80 version:

speluchetti@xxx2:~$ conda update --all
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/speluchetti/conda3/envs/py3env:

The following packages will be UPDATED:

    pytorch: 0.1.11-py360_4cu80 soumith [cuda80] --> 0.1.11-py36_5 soumith

And indeed on the desktop on which I had the slowdown the non-cu80 was installed.

body:
@soumith I found the issue by checking on another computer.

It seems the most recent version of PyTorch wants to upgrade to the non-cu80 version:

```
speluchetti@xxx2:~$ conda update --all
Fetching package metadata ...........
Solving package specifications: .

Package plan for installation in environment /home/speluchetti/conda3/envs/py3env:

The following packages will be UPDATED:

    pytorch: 0.1.11-py360_4cu80 soumith [cuda80] --> 0.1.11-py36_5 soumith
```

And indeed on the desktop on which I had the slowdown the non-cu80 was installed.
